tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: A special early start for Weekend Breakfast as Fauziah Ibrahim and Johanna Nicholson bring you the latest updates on Cyclone Fina with Nate Byrne in Darwin, plus the latest news, interviews, as well as sport with Jared Coote.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.sub-title: First Ashes Test Special from Perth
programme.desc: Australia chase 205 runs to win the First Ashes Test after 19 wickets fell on Day 1 and Mitchell Starc took 10. Abbey Gelmi joins Bharat Sundaresan, Alison Mitchell and Corbin Middlemas at Perth Stadium to discuss the action.

programme.title: Compass
programme.desc: One of Australias most cherished authors and a convert to Judaism, Geraldine Brooks, goes to remote Flinders Island to finally and fully grieve the sudden death of her husband.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Costa explores a new native public garden, Sophie visits a whimsical coastal retreat, Josh finds a lush South American-style courtyard, Tammy discovers a tropical haven, and Millie tours a home that doubles as a greenhouse.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Long Lost Family takes up a double search on Kate Browns behalf and unravels more and more family not just for Kate, but for those she meets along the way.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Richard Rowles plans to live with climate change, by building a flood proof house on the banks of the volatile Brisbane River.

programme.title: Portrait Artist Of The Year
programme.desc: This heat features nine artists from across the country. The sitters are comedian Rhys Nicholson, chef Adam Liaw, and radio/TV host Myf Warhurst.

programme.title: rage Vault: 1999 ARIA Awards
programme.desc: From Diana Ah Naid to Human Nature, The Screaming Jets, Marie Wilson and more, rage lines up the best clips from the ARIA Award winners of 1999.

programme.title: The Art Of...
programme.desc: Namila Benson and Zoe Norton Lodge ask when it comes to magic should we solve or savour it? With Grammy winner Jacob Collier, mentalist Lawrence Leung, designer Marg Horwell, artist Hayley Millar-Baker and a tiny lab-grown brain.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope investigates the mysterious death of a young man whose remains are discovered in remote caves in an area notorious for illicit teenage gatherings.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The final week of Question Time for 2025 begins with coverage from the Senate.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: In an Australian Story special, former politician and Midnight Oil frontman Peter Garrett opens up to Leigh Sales about love, loss and living large.

programme.title: I Was Actually There
programme.desc: Its a day etched into Australian sporting folklore for all the wrong reasons. A moment on a footy field where Nicky Winmar, a proud Noongar man, called out racism.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Pokemon Scarlet and Violet And Human Fall Flat Challenge
programme.desc: This week we catch em all in the wide open Paldea region in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet, plus we take on the challenge of The Tower in Human Fall Flat.

programme.title: rage Guest Programmer: Teen Jesus and The Jean Teasers
programme.desc: Join Teen Jesus and the Jean Teasers as they guest program rage for the very first time, picking their favourite clips and celebrating their new album GLORY.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Theres a snot-tastic dose of Ouchology when the doctors face tough medical questions, and a VIP guest is due in the lab but with a long list of requests, will the Doctors be ready for their arrival?

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: When Marinette and Zoe are chosen to organise the end-of-school-year party, a common enemy of the girls tries to ruin their beautiful friendship.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: In a bid to help move Shirley around the farm, Shaun has the idea of fitting up Shirley with wheels.

programme.title: Crongton
programme.desc: Liccle Bits secret is exposed after the gang stages a break-in to help Venetia.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: The zoos penguin colony gets annual exams, and the staff holds its collective breath as a rare pangolin pregnancy unfolds at the Columbus Zoo.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A look at how World War II played out on the Home Front, featuring Churchills secret loo, the heroic ATA Girls, and German Spies being caught out by their delicious sausages...

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Everything from roads to baths to pies, hosts Emperor Nero and warrior queen Boudicca are here to show what the Romans did while they were here in Britain

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: With A-Troupe all in on Regionals, Pete takes his eyes off The Brawl and auditions for Dance Captain. Olive looks for a place she belongs as Grace dreams of joining A-Troupe.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: A fox arrives at the farm, disguising himself as a handsome ram to infiltrate the flock.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Welcome to the scab factory. The doctors investigate which part of your body heals the fastest, mouth versus knee! Plus in the emergency department, Sophie has a screw in her foot!

programme.title: Gladiators UK
programme.desc: Fury hits hard on the Edge, and Phantom ghosts his opponent in Duel, as the contenders battle it out for a place in the grand final.

programme.title: Rage Ausmusic Month Special
programme.desc: rage celebrates AusMusic Month all November with the creme de la creme of new music videos from Australias best and brightest.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.sub-title: Frankie Boyle, Josh Pugh And Aj Odudu
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by special guests Frankie Boyle, Josh Pugh and AJ Odudu for an entertaining, off-beat look at the big events of the past seven days.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors reveal the amazing organs that keep you alive before youre born, Dr Xand meets patients undergoing treatment at a burns clinic, and Dr Chris hits the high street to test another mind-bending trick.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Id Like To See Goku, You See A Summons From Grand Zeno!
programme.desc: Zeno demands to meet with Goku and asks him for something very odd. Meanwhile in the 10th Universe, Zamasus hatred for humans grows.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania: The Series
programme.desc: Mavis failed attempts to vampnotize her friends doesnt work, but then it works too well on Donald Cartwright, transforming him into the great Count Don!

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: The ER hosts eight heavily pregnant women when a sprinkler bursts in the maternity ward. Benton tries to bring a hopeless patient back from the brink of death in a marathon surgery. Social workers visit Lewis messy home.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Did Ben Franklin really fly a kite tied to a key in a storm and discover electricity? Plus, Adam and Jamie test some scientific facts about flatulance.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil travels to Grappnehall in Warrington to help Colin Brunold sell his four-bed detached house. Colin bought the house with his family 18 years ago, but now the kids are grown up and Colins remarried, its time to sell.

programme.title: Annabel Crabbs Civic Duty
programme.desc: In the early days, Parliament House hosted an all-male conclave of politicians and newspapermen, sharing a cramped environment and a complex code of conventions and mutual dependency. But the age of disruption has arrived.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Shep and Raul respond to a massive house fire without proper gear, risking their lives to save addicts and their children. Dougs relationship with his father worsens. Lewis learns her fate regarding plans to adopt her niece.

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig looks at quacks and quackery, with regular panellist Alan Davies and guest players Victoria Coren Mitchell, Stephen K Amos and Claudia Winkleman.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by comedians Nish Kumar and Fern Brady for an entertaining, off-beat look at the big stories of the past seven days. (Final)

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors choose some of their favourite moments including an experiment to find out what happens when you cough and a life-changing operation that allows someone to hear for the very first time.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Rematch With Goku Black! Enter Super Saiyan Rose
programme.desc: Future Trunks, Vegeta and Goku finally use the time machine with intention to confront Black. But when they arrive, theyre greeted by a familiar face and an unfamiliar power. Will they be able to stand up to this new threat?

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Flock hear the enticing tunes of an ice cream van approaching and quickly hatch a plan to divert it into their field. While the driver seeks help, the Flock have great fun with an endless supply of ice cream.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: Shaggy competes against singer Halsey in a poetry slam.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: Three brother bears awkwardly attempt to find their place in civilized society. Following the shenanigans of baby versions of Grizzly, Panda, and Ice Bear as they tackle on a whole new world together.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.sub-title: Teach A Man To Ice Fish Part 1
programme.desc: When the villain, Confetti Betty, strikes the Odd Squad headquarters in the Arctic, the Mobile Unit returns to help Opal and Omars old squad.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Operation Ouch! doctors explore the incredible human ears, showing everything from what they look like inside, to how your eardrums send sound waves to your brain and why you need sticky ear wax.

programme.title: Bitesize Daily
programme.desc: Learn about longitude and latitude, locating a place and comparing time zones.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Shep and Raul respond to a massive house fire without proper gear, risking their lives to save addicts and their children. Dougs relationship with his father worsens. Lewis learns her fate regarding plans to adopt her niece.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie set out to see if you can fly a normal raft filled with helium and, do cell phones cause airplanes to crash?

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil heads to West Yorkshire to help Alan, Wendy and their teenage daughters sell their family home of eight years. Phil tries to work out why this three-bed semi has been on the market without an offer for over two years.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.sub-title: Can a Bison Buffalo Penn and Teller?
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Marco Grandia, Sylvain Juzan, Alexander Merk and Keona. (Final)

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.sub-title: Tombliboo Ooo Brings The Ball Indoors
programme.desc: The Tombliboos are playing inside when they hear something outdoors. Its the ball.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: One day Bop sees the most beautiful butterfly in Hoopla, but when he catches it, it begins to look sad. He asks his friends to help cheer up the butterfly.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel is helping to make pan pans for dinner at the Platypus house. When Jodi gets distracted by her toy, she almost misses out on the fun, but remembers that dinnertime is better together.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bings friends are coming to his house for a cake party. Sula arrives first and Bing cant wait to show her the cake hes made, but he accidentally tips the cake off its stand and breaks it into pieces.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny and Grandpa Pig come for a dinner party with Mummy and Daddy Pig, but Peppa and George are too tired to go to bed, until they are told a story.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The farmer receives a mystery gift from his antipodean cousin. Unimpressed with the present, he attempts to throw it away only for it to keep reappearing. He becomes convinced it has magical powers.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: When a spell accidentally goes wrong, Ben and Holly grow to human size! Now they are able to play with Lucy and her friends and want to stay big forever!

programme.title: Ariel
programme.sub-title: The Cuttlebaby Sitter / Flounder the Leader
programme.desc: Ariel babysits adorable cuttlebabies. Flounder is chosen as the team coach.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: On a trip to the Dump Dad claims hes the best at everything. But Bluey discovers that Dads throwing out her old drawing and questions if he really is the best Dad in the world.

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: Lauchie is planning to bring Moss to take-your-pet-to-school day, but a jealous Silver Paw turtle-naps her. Can Jeremy and Deena find her in time for the morning school run?

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: Grandma and Timmy want to carve a sculpture out of stone for an art show, that is, if the Mechas can help them learn how to carve.

programme.title: Fireman Sam: Mystery At Pumpkin Hollow
programme.desc: Can the Detectives and The Why Files solve the cases of the mysteriously appearing pumpkins and strange snuffling noises?

programme.title: Maddie + Triggs
programme.desc: Maddie + Triggs sneak and creak their way past Mum and Dads bedroom in search of a tasty treat, only to discover they may not be the only ones searching for a midnight feast.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: The band go back in time to rescue treasure for a fan who turns out to be Maid Marian.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are shocked to find their new bedrooms empty! Mummy and Daddy Pig tell them they will be the ones decorate their rooms, so they all go to a furniture shop to create the best rooms ever!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger releases a cage of Baby Coconutdons into the jungle but quickly learns that theyve been contained for their own good! Ginger and the Baby Pea-Rexes must think of clever ways to get them back.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Sunny suddenly refuses to see the Sweetwood Band. Vida discovers he needs earmuffs for the show!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Duck-billed Platypus
programme.desc: While rescuing river creatures after a storm, the Octonauts find a strange egg.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.sub-title: The Pj Riders Save The Day
programme.desc: The PJ Riders are jealous when the PJs plan to restore their vehicles.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When the Rickety Old Bridge collapses, trapping Toby and Henrietta on the other side of the ravine, Inventor Ruth is asked to build a new one.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and Zsofi plant a colourful edible flower garden, perfect for a yummy garden tea party.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its Richard Rabbits birthday party and George is invited, and that can only mean one thing; Soft Play!

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of The Flying Fox
programme.desc: Peter finds a mysterious key hidden in his fathers journal and is determined to find out what it fits. But his insatiable curiosity leads him into Mr Tods lair and a trap!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Bluey accidentally makes Bingo upset playing a game at dinner, she will do anything to make her happy again - even changing the rules of the game. But nothing seems to work.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The dog and the squirrels decide to play hide and seek and Duggee finds them all except Roly.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: A mystery gossiper causes friction on the berg until Brinicle sets a clever trap.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Tombliboos take a ride on the Ninky Nonk; it goes past Igglepiggle, then Upsy Daisy and then Makka Pakka.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Hoopla is in a mess after a big storm and Jango thinks its too hard to clean up. So he pretends to be sick and tricks his friends into doing his work for him.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.sub-title: Daniel And Miss Elaina Bake Pretzels
programme.desc: At the bakery, Daniel is rolling his dough way too close to Miss Elaina. When Miss Elaina asks nicely for some more space, they each stay on their own baking mats and enjoy making "deeelicious" pretzels together.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing helps Flop do the shopping at Padgets shop but whilst Flop is paying he finds a strawberry lolly that he cant resist putting in his pocket.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa brings home a Teddy from Playgroup to look after, but she is worried that he wont have a very exciting time.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Every time the postman pays the Farmer a visit, Bitzers canine instincts get the better of him, resulting in shredded mail and an irate farmer. Shaun decides to help out by taking on the role of Bitzers therapist...

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Daisy and Poppy turn Nanny Plum into a doll and soon the fairy toy becomes very popular - everyone wants one!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Everyone is getting ready for Mr Bull and Mrs Cows wedding. Peppa and the soon-to-be-weds go to the jewellers to get rings, to the dress makers, to get a wedding dress... and finally, Peppas house to sort the wedding cake.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When Ginger gets stung by an Appleflyus it leaves a painful and incredibly itchy sore but, the only way to cure it is with the tail of an Appleflyus!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Dad gets a severe case of Proximan hiccups. Big Lizard and Cosima do their best to help, but their attempt to scare Dad goes wrong when a real monster turns up!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Emma and Teo meet Kate and Peter, two fire fighters! We learn about the practice of cultural burning and fire fighters, Kiya and Jemima rescue Humpty off a wall! Through The Windows, we see more fire fighters in an animation.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When noisy swans threaten to disrupt Carlos and Drews band performance, the Dream Factory Crew have to find a clever way to lead them away.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Rock Band
programme.desc: Nikhil and Jay start their own rock band! But Nikhil is deflated when Jay keeps inviting other people to join the band. Nikhil wants it to be just the two of them.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector follows a mysterious sound all the way to a hot house. What can it be?

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: Morgan wants to be like his hero - Super Bear - but discovers being a super hero isnt as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles and their Wiggly friends and enjoy songs from around the world! Special guest Bernadette Mate joins The Wiggles, and we learn about the Ukulele - its always a wonderful time on Wiggle and Learn!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today the new baby seat has arrived, but the family car has no room for it! With help from Peppa and George, Daddy Pig chooses a bigger car for the family.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: To plug an air vent at the bottom of the lake, Ginger and the Baby Pea-Rexes must seek the help of the mighty Watermelonsuchus!

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Ottos stinky feet smell like cheese. Vida helps and everyone is happy except Sunny, who loves cheese!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Harbour Seal
programme.desc: When Pesos patient, a remora fish, mysteriously disappears, the Octonauts enlist a unique undersea detective - a harbour seal.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Luna and Motsuki drop Lunas magnet in the moat, and are silly enough to accept Octobellas help getting it.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Yong Bao tells Thomas the story of how he came to have a magnificent tiger emblem on his tender.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and the junior gardeners celebrate her goats Gilly and Gerties birthday with a special fruity surprise a fruit cake made entirely out of fruit!

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles as they explore the excitement of preschool life! Buddy takes you through a day at preschool, from morning routines to playtime and arts and crafts.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family find some great things to buy from the market and even get a special gift from Mr Foxs stall.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima, Big Lizard and Ammon are squabbling over Dads precious Explorer Notebook. When disaster strikes, only by working together can they save it from being lost forever!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Its the hottest day of summer and while Gemma leads a dolphin rescue, Pounce is determined to prove kangaroos can beat the heat.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Gekko wants to stop a speedy Night Ninja - but his lumbering lizards just too slow

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.sub-title: Paddington Becomes A Talent Show Judge
programme.desc: Its the Windsor Gardens Pet show, Paddington is the judge but theyre all so talented how can he choose?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.sub-title: Daisy And Poppy Go To The Museum
programme.desc: Daisy and Poppy and their toddler friends are taken on a trip to the big museum by their teacher Mrs Fotheringill. The naughty toddlers cause chaos and before too long Mrs Fotheringill, has been zapped back to the stone-age.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Buff befriends Mr. Freezes snowcrawler "Snowy".

programme.desc: Mariam Saab presents the latest news, information and warnings on Cyclone Fina, plus the days top stories.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: BBC backlash: As the BBC grapples with its Trump-editing scandal, the spotlight has also swung onto the ABC. But is the criticism fair?

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Join Yvonne Yong for the news from Asia: Bangladeshs ousted leader Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death, arrests made over Delhis deadly bomb attack, plus a success story from Chinese dating show If You Are The One.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: The social media ban wont prevent teens from using YouTube, as long as theyre not logged into an account. But experts warn browsing the site this way could increase the risk of teens being exposed to dangerous content.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Not Stupid
programme.desc: Democrats and Republicans voted unanimously to release the full Epstein files, and Trump has now signed the bill. He had faced growing pressure to make the files public and had a major dispute with a fellow MAGA leader.

programme.title: Live: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: A special early start for Weekend Breakfast as Fauziah Ibrahim and Johanna Nicholson bring you the latest updates on Cyclone Fina with Nate Byrne in Darwin, plus the latest news, interviews and sport with Jared Coote.

programme.title: Live: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: A special extended Weekend Breakfast as Fauziah Ibrahim and Johanna Nicholson bring you the latest updates on Cyclone Fina with Nate Byrne in Darwin, plus the latest news, interviews, as well as sport with Jared Coote.

programme.sub-title: First Ashes Test Special from Perth
programme.desc: Australia chase 205 runs to win the First Ashes Test after 19 wickets fell on Day 1 and Mitchell Starc took 10. Abbey Gelmi joins Bharat Sundaresan, Alison Mitchell and Corbin Middlemas at Perth Stadium to discuss the action.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: Why stellar earnings from market darling Nvidia couldnt stop markets plunging into the red. Plus from flying high to a share price rout, how Droneshield came back to earth. Presented by Alicia Barry.

programme.title: The World This Week
programme.desc: Girish Sawlani presents a roundup of the weeks big stories. Donald Trump approves the release of the Epstein files, Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death in Bangladesh, and deadly Russian strikes on western Ukraine.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.sub-title: The Shoot Out - Race Around The World
programme.desc: Untold stories from behind the scenes of Race Around the World, the show that launched John Safran and become one of the 90s unlikeliest TV hits. (Final)

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.sub-title: First Ashes Test Special from Perth
programme.desc: Australia chase 205 runs to win the First Ashes Test after 19 wickets fell on Day 1 and Mitchell Starc took 10. Abbey Gelmi joins Bharat Sundaresan, Alison Mitchell and Corbin Middlemas at Perth Stadium to discuss the action.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: Growing beneficial bugs to manage insect pests; Championing the achievements of rural women; and how farming has changed since 1945 as the Country Hour celebrates 80 years on-air.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: An ambitious project harnessing the outback sun gets the go ahead, traditional owners seek inspiration to recreate the Juukan Gorge rock shelter, and Australias longest running radio program celebrates a big milestone.

programme.title: Boyer Lecture Series
programme.desc: Julia Baird is joined in conversation with all five 2025 Boyer lecturers, Justin Wolfers, John Anderson, Larissa Behrendt, Amelia Lester and James Curran to reflect on the theme Australia: A Radical Experiment in Democracy.

programme.title: ABC News NT: Cyclone Fina
programme.desc: Live from Darwin, the latest from ABC News NT. Kyle Dowling and the ABC News team bring you comprehensive reporting on Cyclone Fina, plus the days top stories.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.sub-title: The Shoot Out - Race Around The World
programme.desc: Untold stories from behind the scenes of Race Around the World, the show that launched John Safran and become one of the 90s unlikeliest TV hits. (Final)

programme.title: Compass
programme.desc: Theres a disturbing trend taking place in our schools and misogyny is on the rise in classrooms. Siobhan Marin investigates how we can tackle this issue without alienating boys or tipping them further into the manosphere.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: Why stellar earnings from market darling Nvidia couldnt stop markets plunging into the red. Plus from flying high to a share price rout, how Droneshield came back to earth. Presented by Alicia Barry.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: Growing beneficial bugs to manage insect pests; Championing the achievements of rural women; and how farming has changed since 1945 as the Country Hour celebrates 80 years on-air.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers discusses the week in politics with Niki Savva, Tom Crowley and Mark Kenny including Victorian and NSW Liberals topple and install new leaders, plus COP, G20, environment laws, CSIRO cuts and hospital funding.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: What would it mean for Germany if Syrians were to return to their country now that the war is over? Plus in Spain, how Angela Mendoza is making a lucrative business out of evictions.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Global hunger is on the rise for the sixth year in a row. We look at the current state of hunger and the impact it has on the worlds most vulnerable populations.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: Growing beneficial bugs to manage insect pests; Championing the achievements of rural women; and how farming has changed since 1945 as the Country Hour celebrates 80 years on-air.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best original reporting. Kathryn Robinson brings you news, interviews and analysis on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to cover whats happening and why it matters. Kathryn Robinson brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Ukraines choice: losing dignity or risk losing a major partner. Trump sets Zelenskyy a Thanksgiving deadline to decide. Plus Marjorie Taylor Greene to quit Congress in January after a falling out with Trump. (Final for 2025)

Sarah Ferguson is in Canberra for the final sitting week of the parliamentary year, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland and Jacob Greber.
